WorkItem.Description:
I don't have the php_zip.dll installed and tried to use the instruction
 
PHPExcel_Settings::setZipClass(PHPExcel_Settings::PCLZIP);
 
As a result, I've got the following error :
 
"Fatal error: Class 'ZIPARCHIVE' not found inC:\Program Files\wamp\www\master\Classes\PHPExcel\Writer\Excel2007.php on line231"

Comments.Message:
The status of this issue is set to "fixed".
That means we have to wait for a new relase ? Or can we do some modifications on the Excel2007.php file ?

It means that the code changes to fix this issue are in the SVN repository. The latest PHPExcel source code incorporating all fixes can be accessed immediately by downloading the latest version from the "Source Code" tab here on PHPExcel.net

You can also see the files changes for this individual fix by viewing http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/changes/70307 which (again) is accessible from the "Source Code" tab.
Note that it isn't always a good idea to update individual changes, because there may be dependencies on earlier fixes, although this isn't the case with this fix.
